references.paper_title: Optimal-Degree Polynomial Approximations for Exponentials and Gaussian Kernel Density Estimation
references.reason: This paper provides optimal-degree polynomial approximations for exponentials, which are relevant to the approximation of matrix functions.

references.paper_title: Iterative numerical methods for sampling from high dimensional Gaussian distributions
references.reason: This paper introduces iterative numerical methods for sampling high-dimensional Gaussian distributions, which are directly relevant to the applications discussed in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Parameter estimation in high dimensional Gaussian distributions
references.reason: This paper expands on the previous work by addressing parameter estimation in high-dimensional Gaussian distributions, another relevant application area.
This paper proves the superlinear convergence of conjugate gradients, a method closely related to the Lanczos method, providing theoretical background for the current research.

references.paper_title: Error Bounds for Lanczos-Based Matrix Function Approximation
references.reason: This paper provides error bounds for Lanczos-based matrix function approximation, directly contributing to the theoretical understanding of the method's performance.
